data.sentence: The word وَلَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to be saleable, to come out of a hole, be exhausted (store), consumed, spent, expenditure. To enter into another hole where there is another outlet, so is a hypocrite who professes to believe first one thing and then another, thus entering faith through one door and leaving it through another.nafaqan (n.acc.) hole with another outlet, tunnel.nafaqatun (n.) worthy to be spent, expenditure.nafaqu (prt. 3rd p. m. plu. III) practised hypocrisy.nafaqa (v.) to profess hypocrisy, believe in one thing and then another.munafiqun (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqin (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqat (f. plu. III) hypocrite womennifaq (v. n. III) hypocrisynifaqan (v. n. III acc.) hypocrisyanfaqa (perf. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) he had spentanfaqta (perf. 2nd p. m. sing. IV) thou hath spent.anfaqu (perf. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) they have spentanfaqtum (perf. 2nd p. m. plu. IV) Ye have spentyunfiqu (imp. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) spendstunfiquna (imp. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) Ye spendtunfiqu (imp. 2nd p. m. plu. IV acc.) Ye spendanfiqu prt. m. plu. IV) spendinfaq (v. n. ) spendingmunfiqina (m. plu.) those who spend

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانُوا comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.
data.sentence: The word يَعْمَلُونَ comes from the root ع م ل and is associated with the meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.

data.meanings: he wrote it, to dictate it, prescribe/appoint/ordain, judged / passed sentence / decreed, drew/brought together, collected, conjoined / bound, he sewed it, what is written (e.g. of law), mode/manner of writing, book, bookseller, a thing in which or on which one writes, record/register/writ, revealed scripture, a writer/scribe/secretary, an army/military force, troop.
data.sentence: The word كُتِبَ comes from the root ك ت ب and is associated with the meanings: he wrote it, to dictate it, prescribe/appoint/ordain, judged / passed sentence / decreed, drew/brought together, collected, conjoined / bound, he sewed it, what is written (e.g. of law), mode/manner of writing, book, bookseller, a thing in which or on which one writes, record/register/writ, revealed scripture, a writer/scribe/secretary, an army/military force, troop.

data.meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.
data.sentence: The word أَحْسَنَ comes from the root ح س ن and is associated with the meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.

data.meanings: to be small/little. saaghirun - one who is small/little/subdued/abject or in a state of subjection. saghiir - small. asghar - smaller. saghaar - vileness, contempt, humiliation.
data.sentence: The word صَغِيرَةً comes from the root ص غ ر and is associated with the meanings: to be small/little. saaghirun - one who is small/little/subdued/abject or in a state of subjection. saghiir - small. asghar - smaller. saghaar - vileness, contempt, humiliation.

data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word كَبِيرَةً comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).

data.meanings: to cut/sever/disunite/separate/detach, to disable in prosecuting, unable to proceed in, withdrew, break down, perish/cease/finish/fail, cut short / stop, intercepted/interrupted, put an end/stop to, a piece/bit/part/portion cut off from a whole, herd, distinct portion.
data.sentence: The word يَقْطَعُونَ comes from the root ق ط ع and is associated with the meanings: to cut/sever/disunite/separate/detach, to disable in prosecuting, unable to proceed in, withdrew, break down, perish/cease/finish/fail, cut short / stop, intercepted/interrupted, put an end/stop to, a piece/bit/part/portion cut off from a whole, herd, distinct portion.

data.meanings: to pay the blood money, pay a fine as expiation for human life, compensate for murder.
data.sentence: The word وَادِيًا comes from the root و د ي and is associated with the meanings: to pay the blood money, pay a fine as expiation for human life, compensate for murder.

data.meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.
data.sentence: The word لِيَجْزِيَهُمُ comes from the root ج ز ي and is associated with the meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.
